Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different types of habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, or pond.
The student can depict various living things, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants, in each habitat.
The student can include animals like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams in their habitat drawings.
The student can show and label comparisons of the different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can observe and illustrate patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
